authors.name: Andrea R Daniel
authors.note: This protocol was adapted from the work of Sean McCutcheon and colleagues in the Gersbach lab at Duke University.

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"a9eb4","text":"This protocols describes methods for characterizing the activity of dSaCas9 as a activator using promoter tiling guide RNA screens in Jurkat cells. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: CRISPRa, dSaCas9, Jurkat cells, IL2RA, tiling screen
manuscript_citation: {"blocks":[{"key":"ckc8i","text":"McCutcheon, S.R., Swartz, A.M., Brown, M.C. et al. Transcriptional and epigenetic regulators of human CD8+ T cell function identified through orthogonal CRISPR screens.Nat Genet (2023). https://doi.org/10.1038/s41588-023-01554-0","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":44,"length":6},{"style":"italic","offset":168,"length":9},{"style":"sup","offset":105,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
protocol_references: {"blocks":[{"key":"4ik3s","text":"67. Lagmead, B. \u0026 Salzberg, S. L. Fast gapped-read alignment with Bowtie 2. Nat. Methods 9, 357–359 (2012).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e0a6k","text":"\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"76p3c","text":"68. Love, M. I., Huber, W. \u0026 Anders, S. Moderated estimation of fold change and dispersion for RNA-seq data with DESeq2. Genome Biol. 15, 550 (2014).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"el5rq","text":"Polyclonal dSaCas9VP64 and VP64dSaCas9VP64 Jurkat cell lines were generated by transducing Jurkat cells with lentivirus encoding for either dSaCas9VP64–2A–PuroR or VP64dSaCas9VP64–2A–PuroR. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":18,"length":4},{"style":"sup","offset":27,"length":4},{"style":"sup","offset":38,"length":4},{"style":"sup","offset":147,"length":4},{"style":"sup","offset":164,"length":4},{"style":"sup","offset":175,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"buv8n","text":"Cells were selected for 5 days using 0.5 µg ml−1 of puromycin.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":46,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9a9np","text":"After selection, 1 × 106 dSaCas9VP64 and VP64dSaCas9VP64 Jurkat cells were plated and transduced in triplicate with the IL2RA gRNA library lentivirus at a low multiplicity of infection (MOI).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":23,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":32,"length":4},{"style":"sup","offset":41,"length":4},{"style":"sup","offset":52,"length":4},{"style":"italic","offset":120,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4fnrv","text":"Cells were expanded for 10 days, selected for Thy1.1 using a CD90.1 Positive Selection Kit (StemCell Technologies), and stained for Thy1.1 and IL2RA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cgg9p","text":"Transduced cells in the lower and upper 10% tails of IL2RA expression were sorted for subsequent gRNA library construction and sequencing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"90vc8","text":"All replicates were maintained and sorted at a minimum of 500× coverage.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8r9n4","text":"Genomic DNA was isolated using Qiagen’s DNeasy Blood and Tissue Kit. Genomic DNA was split across 100 μl PCR reactions (25 cycles at 98 °C for 10 s, 60 °C for 30 s, and 72 °C for 20 s) with Q5 2× Master Mix and up to 1 μg of genomic DNA per reaction.\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7rf25","text":"PCRs were pooled together for each sample and purified using double-sided (SPRI)bead selection at 0.6× and 1.8×. \n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9ofgk","text":"Libraries were run on a High Sensitivity D1000 tape (Agilent) to confirm amplicon size and quantified using Qubit’s dsDNA High Sensitivity assay.\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9fva3","text":"Libraries were diluted to 2 nM, pooled together at equal volumes, and sequenced using Illumina’s MiSeq Reagent Kit v2 (50 cycles).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7jgdm","text":"Primers are available in Supplementary Table 5 of McCutcheon et al. Nature Genetics, 2023. https://doi.org/10.1038/s41588-023-01554-0","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"10f30","text":"FASTQ files were aligned to custom indexes for each gRNA library (generated from the bowtie2-build function) using Bowtie 2 (ref. 67). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":130,"length":2}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"5B3F3E648FB811EE94090A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.nature.com/articles/s41588-023-01554-0#ref-CR67"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a06lo","text":"Counts for each gRNA were extracted and used for further analysis in R.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4kr9g","text":"Individual gRNA enrichment was determined using the DESeq2 (ref. 68) package to compare gRNA abundance between groups for each screen.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":65,"length":2}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"66BD868A8FB811EE94090A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.nature.com/articles/s41588-023-01554-0#ref-CR68"}}}}

title: CRISPRa tiling screens
